This is a prequel to season 1 as season 2 was delayed several times as one of the main actors had cancer or some shit. 

6 episodes yes.

Andy Whitfield, the guy who plays Spartacus, is the actor who has non-Hodgkin lymphoma.   Starz produced this pre-Spartacus prequel as a stop-gap until Andy could return.

Andy was treated, his cancer went into remission, he began to train for Season 2.  Now the cancer is back, and a replacement will have to be found to play Spartacus.

Demoscat, your 100% correct. That is exactly what is happening. And for everyone else, you should research the facts before you start smashing them for only having 6 episodes or what ever your troubles are. The poor guy and his family are going through a very difficuly time and he is a amazing actor who is suffering, but as usual everyone is out for themselves....Thanks for the upload guys, great as always.

I've just registered so I can chime in, how rude can some people be... I had Non-Hodgkins at the age of 20 and believe me I wished many times during my treatment just to simply not wake up... Luckily I went into remission and I've been fine since. Andy Whitfield is going through this for the 2nd time & you're bothered about a bloody TV series... Yeah Blood & Sand was excellent but why the rush for another series, it'll come when everyones fit & ready.
......PATIENCE

I do not know how many people know it, but Andy Whitfield has succumbed to his cancer.  He has passed away, and I doubt anyone will be able to take over his role and do as good as a job as he did.  Moreover, he has left loved ones behind that I am sure could give a crap about the show, but are so saddened at the loss of a husband and a father.  He was a great actor, and  it will be hard for someone to assume his role and do anywhere near as good as he did.  
R.I.P. -- Spartacus

RIP Andy Whitfield. Brilliant Actor. He will be missed. The show wont be the same without him. My heart goes out to his family and friends. I hope they pay some kind of homage to him in season 2 out of respect.
